intro: Nageia spicata, commonly known as the mountain pine, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is characterized by its needle-like leaves and distinctive cone structure. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in cool, moist climates. Its bark is thick and scaly, providing protection against environmental stress. Nageia spicata plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, supporting diverse wildlife and contributing to forest ecosystems.
